intro: Nasa dyeri subsp. dyeri, commonly known as the silver star cactus, is a species of cactus native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in dense, white to silver-colored spines. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water once established. This succulent is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to adapt to arid environments.
